2012-2013 Scholarship Information

University Scholarships
There are 4 types of scholarship awards available from BYU-Idaho:

Heber J. Grant Scholarships
Awarded to students based on extra-curricular involvement and academic performance.
Application:
  • Heber J. Grant Scholarship application - For the 2013-14 academic year, the application will be available December 1, 2012
Deadline:
  • April 1st
Requirements:
  • Credits
    • Be enrolled in at least 12 credit hours to receive full award.
    • 6-11.5 credits receives a prorated award
    • If students are in their last semester and taking less than 6 credits, they can petition to receive a prorated award.
      • Students must be enrolled in the correct amount of credits by the Financial Aid Determination Date each semester. (See Deadlines for specific date)
      • To petition, send an email explaining your situation to scholarships@byui.edu
  • Fill out Heber J. Grant Application
Criteria:
  • Includes all University Scholarships except the Award of Excellence, Academic Scholarships, and Department Talent awards.
Duration:
  • One academic school year
Accepting Award:
  • Students who receive awards that are determined through the Heber J. Grant Scholarship application are required to submit a Thank You Letter response.  Certain University Aid awards will not be disbursed to the student until a valid Thank You Letter has been processed by the Financial Aid Office.
Important information:
  • Send all questions for the Heber J. Grant Scholarship Application to scholarships@byui.edu.
  • While filling out the application, if your application is idle for 30 minutes you will have to start over.
  • After you submit your application the message, "Thank you. Your application has been submitted" will be displayed once your application has been received by our office.
  • Students will be notified if they receive any awards through their BYU-Idaho email account.

Award of Excellence Scholarships
Awarded exclusively to incoming Freshmen
Application
  • No Application required.
    • All incoming freshman are automatically considered for the award of excellence scholarship.
Requirements:
  • Be a Freshman (have less than 16 college credits)
  • Be enrolled for at least 14 credits during the semester the award is received
Criteria:
  • 60% Extracurricular
    • Church Activity
    • Seminary Attendance
    • Leadership Experience
    • Service (church or community)
    • Extracurricular Activities
    • Admissions Application Essay
  • 40% Academic
    • High School GPA
    • ACT or SAT scores
Award Levels:
  • Full Tuition Plus
  • Full Tuition
  • Half Tuition
  • Quarter Tuition
Duration:
  • Two semesters (the student's first two semesters)
Important Information:
  • Send all questions for the Award of Excellence to: Scholarships@byui.edu
  • Students will be automatically notified if they receive any awards through their BYU-Idaho email account.

Academic Scholarship
Awards offered to students based purely on academic performance.
Application:
  • No Application required.
    • All students are automatically considered for Academic Scholarship awards
Requirements:
  • Credits
    • Must have completed at least 30 cumulative college credits
    • Students with more than 129 cumulative credits at the time of evaluation will not be eligible.
  • Have completed at least one semester at BYU-Idaho
  • Be enrolled in at least 14 credits during the semester of the award.
    • Students in their last semester taking less than 14 credits must petition to receive a prorated award.
      • To petition, send an email explaining your situation to scholarships@byui.edu.

Duration:
  • Academic Scholarships are awarded for a full academic year.
  • Can be received all 3 semesters as long as students take the required 14 credits each semester
Important Information:
  • Evaluation
    • Students who have not yet received an Academic Scholarship are automatically evaluated after each semester
    • After having received an Academic Scholarship, reevaluation occurs after every Wintersemester for the next academic year, regardless of track
      • The Academic Year begins with the Fall semester and ends after the Spring semester.
    • Because the Academic Scholarship lasts for the entire Academic Year, the Winter evaluation will not affect Financial Aid for that Spring.
  • Students will be automatically notified if they receive any awards through their BYU-Idaho email account.
  • Academic Scholarships can not be used in combination with the Award of Excellence. If you received the Award of Excellence, it must be fully dispersed in order to become eligible for an Academic Scholarship.

Robert R. Lee Promise Scholarship Category A
For Idaho residents who have completed high school and are applying to an Idaho college or university.
Application
  • Robert R. Lee Promise Scholarship Category A Application
  • Deadline
    • Must be filled out between November 15th and January 15th
Requirements
  • Be an Idaho resident
  • Effective for the current academic year, be a graduating senior of an Idaho high school or its equivalent
  • Enroll as a full-time (12 credits) student in an academic or professional-technical program at an eligible Idaho college or university
  • Effective for the current academic year, have a cumulative GPA of 3.5 or above and an ACT score of 28 or above
  • Enroll as a full-time student in an academic program at an eligible Idaho college or university.
Important Information
  • For more information go to
    http://www.boardofed.idaho.gov/scholarship/promise_a.asp

Robert R. Lee Promise Scholarship Category B
For Idaho residents who have completed high school and are applying to an Idaho college or university.

Application:
  • No application necessary.
  • Based on information provided on the BYU-Idaho Admissions Application.
  • Students will be notified via e-mail upon reception of award and will be required to submit the Robert R. Lee Promise Scholarship Acceptance form.
Requirements for Incoming Freshman
  • Be an Idaho resident
  • Be under the age of 22 prior to July 1 of the year of the award

  • Effective for the current academic year, receipients must have earned a cumulative GPA of 2.5 or above
  • Be under the age of 22 prior to July 1 of the year of the award
  • Enroll as a full-time (12 credits) student in an academic or professional-technical program at an eligible Idaho college or university
Duration
  • Varies from 1-4 semesters
Important Info:
  • For more questions, go to http://www.boardofed.idaho.gov/scholarship/promiseb.asp

Bureau of Indian Affairs Benefits
Financial Aid for students of Native American heritage

Eligibility:
  • To be eligible for BIA funding, in most cases a student must:
    • Be at least 1/4 Indian blood
    • Be registered with a tribe that has a treaty with the U.S. Gov. and an assigned census number
  • Other requirements may apply.
Application:
  • Students who are eligible to receive BIA awards at BYU-Idaho need to complete the following steps:
    • Notify the BYU-Idaho Financial Aid Office of eligibility for Bureau of Indian Affairs funding
    • Submit a FAFSA form for the current academic year (available at www.fafsa.ed.gov)
    • Contact the appropriate tribal agency or office and request:
      • An application
      • Privacy release form
      • Other required forms and documents (based on tribal requirements)
    • Submit the privacy release form to the BYU-Idaho Financial Aid office
    • Submit the application and other required forms to the proper tribal agency or office
    • At the end of each semester students must send a copy of their grades to the tribe
Important info:
  • Policies regarding BIA benefit awards are not managed or controlled by BYU-Idaho. For more information regarding BIA awards students may contact the associated tribal agency.


2013-2014 Scholarship Information

University Scholarships
There are 4 types of scholarship awards available from BYU-Idaho:

All University Scholarships (with the exceptions of talent and leadership scholarships) are now evaluated through the BYU-Idaho (Heber J. Grant) Scholarship Application.

This change is taking place in order to allow students to be considered for more financial aid opportunities. By completing this one comprehensive application, students will be evaluated for both Academic Scholarships and all other all other General Scholarships offered at BYU-Idaho.

The Academic Scholarship GPA requirements are changing (see Academic Scholarships for Continuing Students below).

The process is easy:
  1. Complete the 2013-2014 BYU-Idaho Scholarship Application by April 1, 2013. (The Application will be available November 1, 2012.)
  2. Your application information along with your GPA, major, credits earned, etc. will be compared to the criteria of all available scholarships offered at BYU-Idaho. If you meet the qualifications of a particular scholarship(s) you will then be considered for that award. Your award could possibly include an academic scholarship, a general BYU-Idaho scholarship, or both.
  3. You will be notified by the end of April 2013 of any possible awards.
General BYU-Idaho Scholarships
There are many scholarships donated to BYU-Idaho by generous donors who wish to help students obtain an education. These scholarships are based on the specific individual requirements of the scholarship. Demonstrate financial need; Self-reliance and extra-curricular involvement will also be considered.
Application:
  • The BYU-Idaho Scholarship application - For the 2013-14 academic year, the application will be available November 1, 2012
Application Deadline:
  • April 1st, 2013
Requirements for General Scholarships:
  • Complete the BYU-Idaho Scholarship Application
  • Be enrolled for at least 12 credits during the semester the award is received.
    • 6-11.5 credits receives a prorated award
    • If students are in their last semester and taking less than 6 credits, they can petition to receive a prorated award.
      • Students must be enrolled in the correct amount of credits by the Financial Aid Determination Date each semester. (See Deadlines for specific date)
      • To petition, send an email explaining your situation to scholarships@byui.edu
  • No more than 140 earned credits at the time of evaluation
Criteria:
  • Meet the basic requirements of the general scholarships.
  • Other factors considered may include:
    • financial need
    • self-reliance
    • involvement in extracurricular activities
  • Students are encouraged to do all they can for themselves to pay for their education. Working, saving, living frugally and sacrificing unnecessary things, etc. are ways of becoming self-reliant
Award Duration:
  • One academic school year (Fall 2013 through Spring 2014)
  • Students will be awarded for those semesters which they indicate on the BYU-Idaho Scholarship Application.
Accepting Award:
  • Students who receive a General BYU-Idaho scholarship are required to submit a Thank You Letter.These letters are given to the generous donors who donate these scholarships to BYU-Idaho. Awards will not be disbursed to the student until a valid Thank You Letter has been received by the Student Financial Aid Office.
Important information:
  • Send all questions for the BYU-Idaho Scholarship Application to scholarships@byui.edu.
  • Students will be notified if they receive any awards through their BYU-Idaho email account.
  • **NEW**If you have a General BYU-Idaho Scholarship and then you become eligible for an academic scholarship later on in the academic year, your General BYU-Idaho Scholarship may be reduced or eliminated.
    • This is done because General BYU-Idaho Scholarships are largely based on financial need and your need was met by your academic scholarship.
    • Students will be notified if they receive any awards through their BYU-Idaho email account.
  • Scholarships will be based on the number of credits that you are registered for on the last day to drop classes without receiving a W grade. This date, which usually falls around the third week of each semester, is referred to as the Financial Aid Determination Date (FADD). It is the student's responsibility to be aware of the FADD each semester, as well as their individual credit requirements.
    • Academic Scholarships for Freshmen and Continuing students - If a student is enrolled in less than 14 credits as of midnight on the FADD, the entire amount of the academic scholarship will be reversed and the student will be required to return these funds.
    • General BYU-Idaho Scholarships - If a student is enrolled in less than 12 credits but at least 6, the award amount will be prorated based on the number of credits on (FADD). If a student has less than 6 credits, the entire scholarship will be returned.

Academic Scholarship for Continuing Students
Awards offered to students based solely on academic performance.
Application:
  • **NEW** The BYU-Idaho Scholarship application is required- For the 2013-14 academic year, the application will be available November 1, 2012.
Application Deadline:
  • April 1st, 2013
**NEW** Requirements:
  • Complete the BYU-Idaho Scholarship Application.
  • Completion of at least one semester at BYU-Idaho.
    • If you have between 12 and 27.9 credits, your BYU-Idaho GPA and high school GPA will be averaged together for consideration of this award.
    • Upon completion of at least 28 cumulative college credits your cumulative BYU-Idaho GPA will be considered (see below).
  • No more than 129 cumulative credits at the time of evaluation.
  • Minimum credit requirements:
    • Be enrolled in at least 14 credits during the semester of the award.
      • Students in their last semester taking less than 14 credits may receive a prorated award.
      • To request a prorated award during your last semester, send an email explaining your situation to scholarships@byui.edu.
